p: The mechanistic route behind the use of acetylcholinesterase inhibitors as a treatment for AD is still unclear. A recent study suggested that the breakdown of ACh is prevented by these drugs. As the disease progresses, there would be a dip in amount of ACh in the brain, resulting in non-functional cholinesterase inhibitors.
